definitions.definition: (the emotional or physical reaction to) a sudden, unexpected, and usually unpleasant event or experience:
examples: Her mother's death came as a great shock - it was so unexpected.

definitions.definition: an unpleasant feeling that you experience when something new or unusual happens:
examples: It's really hard getting back to work after three months off - it's quite a shock to the system.

definitions.definition: to offend or upset someone by doing or saying something that they consider is immoral or unacceptable:
examples: The advertisements were designed to shock - that was the whole point of the campaign.
